website_summaries.verdict: From the fit to the construction quality, these arthritis gloves excel where many others fall short.
pros: Fingerless design allows for daily tasks
Provides compression, warmth, and extended coverage even for the last knuckles
Excellent quality and durable stitching outlasts most others
Cotton/Spandex blend is flexible and breathable while remaining firm enough to deliver effective relief
cons: A bit costly, but most owners find them superior to similar models

customer_reviews.title: Great for osteoarthritis!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! My hand therapist recommended them and I can't believe how much more comfortable my hands are when I type and do other activities that require detailed and find hand/finger motions. I have osteoarthritis and have had surgery to correct de Quervan's Syndrome. This is not a paid endorsement - I paid for my gloves!
customer_reviews.author: KAI

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best arthritis gloves ever! I have purchased and used many others, but these feel the best. I especially like the length of the fingers--they cover all my knuckles and just expose the fingertips. I use them every day when I am crocheting and they keep my hands and wrists pain free!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Great relief
customer_reviews.text: These gloves really help my hands when I’m crocheting! This is the main reason I bought them. I have a lot of gifts to make. Tonight I’m going to try to sleep with them to see if they help for morning stiffness. The compression is great and the size spot on. I followed the sizing instructions. I probably need to order another pair for when one is in the wash. I have ordered other brands and these are my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The gloves worked well at first, and were comfortable. After a week of intermittent use when typing on the computer (they were never even washed) the gloves have completely ripped apart. I liked these as they did seem to help, but for the price, for them to not even last a week is inexcusable.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: These cover my hands better than other brands I’ve tried
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a glove that covered my hand almost to my fingertips. I have osteoarthritis on all joints in my hands. These cover my hands better than other brands I’ve tried. The fit is nice and tight. The stitching and quality of the glove looks like they should hold up well. I mainly wear these at night but I can see wearing them when needed during the day and they would not hinder any work that I may be doing. It’s the compression that helps my arthritis. There’s no medical miracle cure attached to them ....i.e. copper. I’ve tried those gloves too. I think I’ll stick with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: CMS

customer_reviews.title: The fit is perfect, and I love how they cover all the ...
customer_reviews.text: I think of this as a provisional review. I received the goods today. The fit is perfect, and I love how they cover all the way to the last knuckle. It really should help with my arthritic hands. I say provisional because I've only worn them for 30 minutes while knitting. If there is a downside it would apply to all of these kinds of gloves not just this brand: the fabric has no texture so they slip especially on my knitting needles, but I will learn to work with them.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: These aren't very well constructed. The seams on the inside are uncomfortable and there is also an irritating tag. Might have been ok to wear them inside out, but the seams around the fingers are too tight and constrict circulation while the gloves themselves aren't tight enough to be helpful. .
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Rose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Cold Hands
customer_reviews.text: I searched amazon far and wide to find the perfect gloves that allowed me to do my homework while in a cold library. I get cold very easily and these gloves do not make it difficult to type or use my phone. I had the smart, touch sensitive gloves that covered the fingertips, but they were bulky and I could not write really well with them. These are just right. I know that your fingertips are exposed, but its only a little bit, so don't worry. As for pain relif, I did not get them for that, I just liked how light weight and usable they are for day to day wear.
customer_reviews.author: chocolatecakez24

customer_reviews.title: Painful seam with hard plastic that digs into my skin
customer_reviews.text: I wanted well made gloves that would last & these would have been perfect.! I am a female with lage hands and it's hard to find gloves that fit. The problem with these gloves is that the inside seam was sown with some kind of hard plastic in between. It really diggs into my hand and inside wrist. Then after three days of wearing the gloves the seam that doesn't have the hard plastic sown in has split open and come undone. The torn seam would have been fine but the hard plastic hurts & is the deal breaker! I am letting my family members know that they should never buy this brand of compression gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Ariella Candelaria

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to make a size choice work for me. I have small hands, and agree with reviews that suggested following the measurement chart. Small probably would have been too small. But, the medium are a bit longer in the fingers than I need them to be. The compression is more in the fingers than in the thumb joint and palm of hand--which is where I hoped it would be. Material is warm and soft with a nice grip!
customer_reviews.author: winter

customer_reviews.title: Fingers rip  apart after two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: After one month the gloves looked like the picture. I don't mind stitching up a side as mistakes happen in manufacturing. The stitching came apart on each finger. I got tired of stitching the fingers and contacted the company in August. They offered to replace them, but it has been over two months and no gloves. I would not recommend buying these gloves. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: baseball9585

customer_reviews.title: Basically overpriced snug gloves
customer_reviews.text: I double checked the pictures and description to be sure but what isn't mentioned is is that they are "moderate compression" I bought them in the hopes it would help my hand/wrist joint stiffness. If you have bigger hands and order the small maybe they'll do that but for me they were more or less snug gloves. They may have helped minimally they joints of my fingers but they weren't even snug around my thumb or wrists so I returned them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not extremely happy
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know yet. I just got these. I got a medium. They are as snug as they need to be I think, so that you can still function. And so that your circulation isn’t cut off. I feel like the wrist part should be a tad more snug but I have very small wrists. I’ll update after I have worn them for a few days. My hand is a medium size. I measured and chose medium based on the sizing info Update: I’ve worn them a bit and they are raveling apart. I’ve had to sew them back up several times and they are constantly unraveling. I wish they were better made
customer_reviews.author: 🌷Whattajewell🌷

customer_reviews.title: Soft gloves extremely comfortable with no sweaty palms
customer_reviews.text: Material feels great on skin. ✋ medium so I bought a small; because of soft material need XS to benefit from pain relief. The Grippy dots in palm most definitely useful when you're constantly dropping things due to illness. Long rubber lines around all points in ✋ would make product really amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Chante' Carter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after I had strained the muscles in my hand. At that point, I was in almost constant pain, and was debating whether I should set up an appointment to see a specialist. However, I came across these and decided that I would try them out - I’m so glad I did! The first time I wore these, I had them on for only a few minutes before they started alleviating the pain in my hands. I’m normally skeptical of products like this, but I’m definitely a believer now. I’ve had them for a few months and whenever I start to feel any hint of pain in my hands I put these on and they help immensely.
customer_reviews.author: the.design.jedi

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves great service
customer_reviews.text: I have a broken arm which resulted in a very swollen hand. My doctor said to start using a compression glove and this seems to be working. I had an issue with the first pair so contacted manufacturer. What great customer service. Since I cannot drive I could not return the first pair so they sent me a new pair the same day. Great gloves and great service.
customer_reviews.author: Emily J. Truett

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use while crocheting. Unfortunately I am clumsy with gloves on and cannot wear them for that purpose, but I have been wearing them much of the time besides that. They are comfortable and the compression feels great. I do not have arthritis but I am anticipating it being a problem as I crochet for a living and work with my hands in my free time. These gloves are also quite stylish and made of a nice material.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Rae HAgberg

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on day 2
customer_reviews.text: I have had the gloves for 2 days and the right hand glove has already ripped. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Malvey

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be a great glove, but runs small (update with larger gloves)
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a slightly tweaked variation of the IMAK compression glove with grip dots on the palm, which makes many tasks MUCH easier. However, I followed the sizing directions and ordered a medium size, which runs a bit small for a man's hand. I had them on for about 30 seconds when my fingertips turned purple. I have ordered the large size, and anticipate a better experience. UPDATE: In my experience, the Imak gloves are not so compressive as these, even with the larger size. The grip dots are very useful (especially for driving), but make the gloves overall a bit stiffer in flex. Definitely will buy again when these decompose after use/washing. Effective for arthritis symptoms.
customer_reviews.author: The Poolroom Loafer

customer_reviews.title: All companies need to wait at least 3 months before asking for reviews.
customer_reviews.text: It's a gift... I have no clue if they will like it and if it holds up. Only giving 1 star because I don't know yet. All companies really need to ask for reviews at least 3 months later.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Schweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Arthritis relief
customer_reviews.text: I have destructive rheumatoid arthritis in all different areas of my body. My wrists thumbs and some of my fingers have erosion. These gloves help relieve the pain and help me get through those tough days and keep me going.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes my hands feel super stiff
customer_reviews.text: I have moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis. Waking up with flared up hands is very common for myself. I have had difficulties putting on these gloves and need assistance most of the time. And usually once I have the gloves on I am still limited in movement. It seems I can’t really fold my fingers very well to grab anything. Honestly it’s a hassle to have to takeoff the clothes and put them back on when I have to go to the restroom. I have been wearing these gloves for over two weeks now and I don’t see much of a difference in it helping me.
customer_reviews.author: Myztyqui

customer_reviews.title: Offers a Small Amount of Relief for Rheumatoid Arthritis
customer_reviews.text: These compression gloves seem to offer a small amount of relief for my rheumatoid arthritis suffering wife. She says wearing them is a bit painful but nowhere near as painful as if she doesn't wear them. Take that for what it's worth. They look life fingerless gloves. In fact, when I first saw them I wasn't certain these were what she had ordered. It was and they are.
customer_reviews.author: By CJs Pirate

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy and reduces my pain level instantly.
customer_reviews.text: They are a little long for my short fingers and they dry out my hands a little. Other than that they are great! They are very comfortable and it is easy to perform tasks. I have recommended them to a friend already.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Cox

customer_reviews.title: They are just okay...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves for general use during long note taking and while crocheting. I noticed that there were fraying around the finger holes when putting the gloves on for the first time. At the time of this review, I have only worn the gloves for 3 hours but it is apparent that the fabric is not going to last. The fabric around the wrist bunches up. I wish there was something to help the fabric stay down to help support the wrist. I would not buy these gloves again but they aren’t the worst thing. The grips is good while driving and the gloves keep my hands relatively warm.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Matthews

customer_reviews.title: There is still a decent amount of compression so I'm glad I went with the large
customer_reviews.text: Hands measured 3 1/8", but ended getting the large instead of medium because some of the reviews complained about the medium too small. There is still a decent amount of compression so I'm glad I went with the large. I took one star off because the stitching combined with the compression on the inside of the gloves hurt after about half an hour. The simple solution....wear the gloves inside out. It looks ugly with all the stitching showing on the outside, but it feels great on the hands themselves. Since I'm wearing this inside my house, who cares what it looks like on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Doppleganger

customer_reviews.title: Good compression, scratchy fabric, prominent seams
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my sore and cold hands. They do a good job of compressing and warming my hands. The open fingertips make it easy to use devices and anything you need tactile feedback on. I found the fabric annoyingly scratchy and am not sure I can adjust to that enough to tolerate hours-long use. I highly recommend removing the single outer tag and wearing the gloves inside out. The prominent seams along the sides of the palms and fingers are quite irritating otherwise. A good price if you can tolerate the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate.  My hands LOVE these!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th or 5th purchase of these fingerless gloves. I sleep in them! I’ve given them to family & friends who love them. Don’t spend big money on these type of gloves. Takes pain away from hands. Circulation improved. Hands hurt/ache? I promise you’ll love these!
customer_reviews.author: Kyla Petit

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful gloves, tight, and look great Durable material Saved my fingers from “texting thumb” I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T

customer_reviews.title: Wow great product, great company they care about you what a blessing
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I had written a review about the arthritis gloves being to big they are good quality. I had mentioned in my review that I was going to contact this company about a return possibly for a smaller pair. I didn't even send them a message 😀 and they asked me my mailing address so they could send out a size small I would give them many stars⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ they really care about their customers
customer_reviews.author: Fun2bw6288

customer_reviews.title: Great Compression Gloves
customer_reviews.text: When I take long walks, my hands often swell and become very stiff. I wore these during my last 5K and they worked great. Comfortable and not too heavy. I definitely recommend. I also periodically suffer from severe autoimmune swelling in the joints of my hands, effectively causing carpel tunnel (pain, stiffness and numbness in fingers and wrists). These days, I wear them off and on everyday, and eventually the gloves will stretch out. Still, they are helpful enough that I will buy a new pair to regain the full effects of the compression. The pair will last several months before they wear out, depending on how often i put them on.
customer_reviews.author: missscolleen

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from Raynaud's disease; a condition that leaves my fingers turning cold and blue. I purchased these gloves to keep my fingers warm without losing dexterity and range of motion. They work perfectly! I wear them in the supermarket because I was always losing circulation in my fingers while shopping. I no longer have to hang out under the hot lights with the chickens! I am 5' 5" so I purchased the medium size. They are snug but not too tight. I would recommend these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Mollymalone

customer_reviews.title: Helps with soft tissue swelling
customer_reviews.text: I broke the knuckle on my right ring finger. After weeks in a cast, my ring finger & little finger were still very swollen. The swelling was painful & preventing me from making any progress with my PT. Got these on a Monday, went to PT on Wednesday & had a measurable difference in the circumference & mobility. Well worth the price & very comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Bekia

customer_reviews.title: Like the anti-slip feature
customer_reviews.text: I got this for working around the house and cooking. The anti-slip feature is definitely a plus. I have small hands and wear small size gloves. When I measured according to the chart I was right at the upper limit of small size. I was debating between small and medium but I decided to get small and it was a little tight the first day but it stretched a little bit afterward so it worked out just fine. provided comfortable compression. It is a good product and reasonably priced. Will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: WM in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had to put a few stitches in a couple of seams that have ripped but I wear them a lot. Otherwise they have held up great and are very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: toogles

customer_reviews.title: Seem to reduce achy hands
customer_reviews.text: My partner does wood turning, but has very arthritic hands. These are light weight enough to wear while he’s turning and elastic enough not to interfere with his dexterity. He says his hands seem to ache less after wearing them. When dirty, you can just throw them in the washer.
customer_reviews.author: Munchie

customer_reviews.title: Have recommended these to everyone!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my sister who works 40+ hours/week in service and has suffered with terrible pain in both hands for years because of it. She has been pain free since she started wearing them and cannot imagine working without them! She even ordered another pair in case one gets soiled. Planning on a pair for our mom next.
customer_reviews.author: bubblesup

customer_reviews.title: Warm, light, just right.
customer_reviews.text: As described. I compared these to the copper-infused gloves. The copper ones are a bit thinner and lighter *almost too much* but these gloves feel comfortable, easy on and off, and keep my fingers and knuckles from hurting while typing all day in the cold dry winter months *arthritis people know the pain*. I call them my handy boxers. Highly recommended. I had a loose thread on one, and the company sent a replacement right over.
customer_reviews.author: C. CALLAWAY

customer_reviews.title: Ahhh!  Pain relief!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. I wear them every day and sometimes at night. The compression keeps the swelling down, protects my fingers from painful bumps and bends. They also keep heat in which helps. I have painful arthritic fingers. A couple of them feel & look broken - they're not, it's just arthritis. These gloves help! I love them. I've bought 5 pairs so far. I wash & dry them with my regular laundry. Don't use vinegar - I think it degrades the color. It was a hassle at first to take them off to use the bathroom & wash hands., but I got used to it, have a system and it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I have terrible arthritis and swelling which is very painful. I wear these everyday. They work better than my pain meds
customer_reviews.author: statru72

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for arthritis pain
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis pain in my fingers and these gloves are great because they extend past the second joint. They are compression gloves but not overly tight. The material is soft and comfortable. Not too warm either. I haven't washed them yet but they seem very well made. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy H

customer_reviews.title: So far they're helping severe arthritis
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with these gloves. Bought them for a family friend who is a retired/disabled iron worker. Last couple weeks I have stopped by his hands were so swollen from arthritis he could barely move them. And he was in a lot of pain. So I figured these would be worth a shot. He did have to wait for the swelling to go down a little before he could get them on. But he says they are comfortable to wear. He likes the warmth they provide, but wishes they were designed to be a little warmer. He said so far they are definitely helping and he will continue to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: E. Shapi

customer_reviews.title: I think it's a toss up...
customer_reviews.text: I really REALLY wanted to love these. They are soft and pretty comfortable but the seams are bulky and oddly placed. This could just be a fluke. There is a tag on the inside that is very uncomfortable but I know if I try to cut it out it will cause a hole in the seam. I ordered a medium based on their size chart and the seem loose and the wrist part creeps up. With that being said, I did wear them while sleeping and my hands seem less swollen today, which is ultimately the point, right? The grippies are great, not too thick. I'm still undecided if I'll return them or not. That dang tag...
customer_reviews.author: Brian and Jalal

customer_reviews.title: It's itchy from sewing and labels inside
customer_reviews.text: Gloves look nice but for they're scratchy inside seams specially on my pinky and wrists. On the wrists inside one glove has size label sewn into the seam and 2nd glove has small label with DFO on it. Ends/sides of these labels feel burned with hard ends and they scratch skin when you're wearing gloves. They warm, true to size, flexible fabric not like lycra but feels comfortable holding your hands (if eliminate scratching part). I couldn't use them doing some computer work or write something etc because fingers is long and as I mentioned fabric not that flexible as lycra. But if you just sitting and watching TV it fine (of course if they not itchy).
customer_reviews.author: MARY

customer_reviews.title: It has made a difference in arthritis pain
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who is a musician and has arthritic fingers. After playing for two or three hours his hands would hurt so much he'd have to take pain medication. These pressure gloves don't completely remove the pain, but they do make it bearable. Now, when he practices every day, he wears the gloves. When he does a gig (not much gigging at the moment) he doesn't wear them during the gig but does before and after. Just putting them on afterward helps to keep the pain down.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieMae

customer_reviews.title: Seams ripped out first day
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable and light weight enough to use as a cashier HOWEVER 1 pair made it 6 days and the left thumb seam totally unraveled , the second pair didn't even make it through 1 day without the entire pinky finger seam coming undone. If they could figure out how to make their seams stay together, it would be a good product. But I pretty much flushed $30.00 down the toilet. Avoid at all costs. They may work if you wear them to bed, but if you actually wear them to do anything, no go.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L. Olson

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!  :-)
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very impressed on how they feel, let alone how cool they also look. LOL At first I thought the Small would be too small because once I worked it up, it fit perfectly...nice and snug the way they are intended to fit. I can bend my fingers, so it won't stop you from typing, etc, but the elastic keeps the glove nice and snug against the skin. I hope they won't loose their durability after usage/washing, but for now, I am very pleased with them. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Hedy

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: My hand measured just under the width of the large measurement and at first I thought the gloves were too tight but after wearing them for a couple of hours I found that they fit well. The gloves relieved the finger joint pain that I usually have during the night and during the day. These are like indoor house slippers not meant for any serious work outside. I like them and am seriously thinking about buying a second pair. One for day time and one for sleep time.
customer_reviews.author: lnsng

customer_reviews.title: Fit really nice
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several versions of gloves. these are the best I have found. Fit tight to my hands with the right amount of compression. I really like that the fingers cover all but the tips of my fingers, because the pain is in the whole finger. i had a more expensive pair them were measured for me and fit my husband. These were an excellent price. I found them listed at the top of a top rating list online and the reviews were correct.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna L. Gutoski

customer_reviews.title: I have poor circulation in my hands so in winter my hands ...
customer_reviews.text: I have poor circulation in my hands so in winter my hands can get really cold. I just tried the gloves and am typing with them they are light weight and the open fingers allow me to use my keys on iPad and phone. My hand is warming up too I’d highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage. Product ripped right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth a cent. You'd be better off wrapping plastic wrap around your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Dan T

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: I have rheumatoid arthritis and I work as a receptionist and I'm not a computer 8 hours a day. A lot of my inflammation and swelling is in my hands and it's hard to find a good compression glove that still allows me the freedom to type. I can't say enough good things about these gloves. They fit perfectly, are just tight enough to provide the compression that I need yet comfortable enough to do my daily activities. Thank you thank you thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Have other compression gloves but these are so comfortable and instantly relieved the pain in my fingers. Purchased a M based on the measurement chart but I probably could have used a small for a snugger fit and more compression.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly as described on the site. They arrived quickly and I found them to be well made and very helpful with my lifelong hand cramping problem. I like the open fingers as that allows me to continue with most activities without damaging the gloves. Great price and product.
customer_reviews.author: ln512

customer_reviews.title: Constant wearing
customer_reviews.text: Keeping the hands wrapped so firmly is a plus and seems to help with the pain. The open fingers allow me to still do my job. The only issue I have is the material. The only down side is, obviously, for it to work, you need to wear it consistently; going to the bathroom, doing anything with water, is inconvenient as you have to remove the gloves or deal with the wetness. All in all, I do like it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl O.

customer_reviews.title: I've issues with my hands hurting terribly and swelling
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a couple to these compression gloves and I keep coming back to Dr. Frederick's. I've issues with my hands hurting terribly and swelling. I've found that I have to buy "large" sized (I usually wear small sized gloves) because of the swelling in my joints. These feel comfortable on my hands. They don't necessarily limit the movement on my hands but they do help keep my thumbs in place. One thing I've noticed though is that the price keeps going up, each time I buy a new pair. I do, however, like the product
customer_reviews.author: Beth Rattleff

customer_reviews.title: Good for eczema too!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have been my life line for my terrible eczema. I know these are for arthritis but they have helped me feel more normal at work because they are more nonchalant than the gel lined ones. They can take a while to stretch out but once they do they are great to put over Vaseline slathered hands. Unfortunately my dog got a hold of them after they were nice and perfect so I had to buy more. I love them so much.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Pyle

customer_reviews.title: Get these through a professional with correct sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Got these to help with my tendon pain because I use my hands for work so much. First thing I noticed is they ripped at the seams when putting them on, quick stitch fixed that. Followed sizing instructions, wore them and felt great. Then my finger tips started to tingle and then hurt. Took them off And haven’t worn them since and my finger tips are still red, tingly and painful making my already in pain hands even worse. Maybe I needed larger gloves, my hands are 3 inches across so I got medium but Im so dissatisfied I don’t even want to try a different size.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming at best
customer_reviews.text: I got these gloves two weeks ago. Since I have arthritis in both thumbs I tried an experiment. I have been wearing the left glove whenever I get a chance, often in the evening when I am watching TV or reading. After 14 day I have noticed absolutely no difference between the two hangs in terms of discomfort. I was hoping for some reduction in the aching and I have noticed absolutely no difference between my two hands. No difference at all. This is disappointing to say the least and I will most likely try to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorT

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves but I might have needed larger size
customer_reviews.text: Gloves do help when working, I don't have nearly the hand pain. I do wear work gloves over the arthritis gloves for extra padding. I bought medium size where I was at the upper measurement. With my osteoartritis I have a hard time taking off the gloves as they peel inside out and I can't get them back to right side out. I ended up buying a large size but still have inside out issues because my hands / thumbs can't seem to grab the little edges. Mostly, you have to pull off one finger at a time which is difficult for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B Gossett

customer_reviews.title: I was worried that these might not be as effective but they are great! I like that the fingers are longer than ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried these and one other pair of gloves. The other pair I have are copper infused and haven't held up well--split seams and stretching. I was worried that these might not be as effective but they are great! I like that the fingers are longer than on other gloves so they almost cover both sets of knuckles. I mainly wear at night because I was waking up with numb and/or swollen hands and with these, my hands are fine in the morning and I haven't had to deal with any numbness or swelling. They seem to be well made and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I might suggest buying a size larger than what your measurements are, mine are snug enough on the fingers that I lose circulation but that might be what's supposed to happen or maybe my fingers are swelling in the gloves but either way. They're still a good product, good quality, seams aren't painful or jutting into your skin. They do provide warmth to your hands when on, the wrist is loose where the fingers are snug on mine.
customer_reviews.author: PixicusRex

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill- just what my hands need.
customer_reviews.text: I've turned the corner and am noticing stiffness. Plus I generally keep the thermostat at 65 in winter months, so I was looking for some gloves that would keep my hands toasty. Any benefits for stiffness will be welcome, but having just received these, I can't testify to whether it helps or not. I did want to keep my finger tips exposed for using the computer keyboard. I have square shaped hands, so I ordered the large. The size is mostly good. The fingers are for a man sized finger, so they cover more of my finger than in the photo, but should work for my purposes. I like the material.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Bank

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable level of compression
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like these gloves overall. I only use it on one hand and it’s not for arthritis, so I cannot speak to their ability to help those symptoms. Mild to moderate compression, feels good. My biggest problem is the giant, uncomfortable tag on the inside. I’m very surprised the makers overlooked that. For people whose hands are already painful and sensitive, a giant tag on the inside is very uncomfortable. When I decide I’m definitely keeping them, I’ll cut the tag out, but it would be great if the tag was never there in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: BabyNurse07

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with the product and the company
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the product. It has helped me to use my hands with less discomfort. I initially ordered the medium size and it turned out to be a little small. Dr. Frederick's had sent me an e-mail asking if I was satisfied with their product. I responded concerning the fact the medium size was too small. They sent me the large size gloves at no charge and didn't even request the return of the first pair. That's service!
customer_reviews.author: Frank A. Terry Jr.

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are terrific, they relieve the soreness from arthritis pain without ...
customer_reviews.text: I have osteoarthritis in a very unusual place in both my left and right hands thus, the reason for purchasing these gloves. In addition, I had carpal tunnel syndrome surgery on my right hand during the late summer. For some time I was wearing a stiff brace to relieve the pressure and discomfort but really wanted to wear gloves for much of the day on both hands. These gloves are terrific, they relieve the soreness from arthritis pain without so much pressure that I loose feeling in my fingers. I sleep in them and feel better upon waking.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M. Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought these just for the "fit" of the gloves. Don't have joint pain, but I like the slim fit, mild compression, and open fingertip design of the gloves. So I just use them as everyday outdoor gloves and when it's really cold, I wear them under heavier gloves. When I use my iPhone, I remove the warmer gloves and it's great to have these slim, open fingertip gloves so I easily do tasks and still have some warmth from the gloves. Have very small hands for woman, so the small size worked well, but the length of the finger material is a little long for my fingers... but it's workable.
customer_reviews.author: Susan J

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t help.
customer_reviews.text: Wrong size was delivered. First set of gloves had some large rough seams that caused severe pain after wearing them for one night. A replacement was sent but seem to have the same types of seams on the inside of the glove. There also does not seem to be enough compression to help alleviate any pain from my RA. It was a nice concept and I was pleased that the company offered to replace them free of charge but all in all they didn’t work for my pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Such A relief
customer_reviews.text: It is such a relief that I found these gloves that go all the way to the top knuckle because it helps w the tingling that I am now experience due to the mild carpal tunnel they told me I have. I still have not mastered typing with both in a comfortably way but I am getting there. I even slept with them and they didn't cut circulation and helped. My boss who wears some gloves she cut at the tips has just order a pair because she liked the feel and the grip dots it has. Thinking of buying a pair for the house so they won't get linty sleeping with them.
customer_reviews.author: Irma S

customer_reviews.title: Now hands don’t hurt
customer_reviews.text: These gloves were a revelation for me. I wear them at night and, since I began doing that, my arthritic hands do not hurt during the day. I have the original version (size M) and also the “grip” version (needed a size S). I figure if I can keep the pain at bay, I can stay (so far) arthritis-prescription-medication-free. Hurray!
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Abuela

customer_reviews.title: Great compression, hit and miss quality.
customer_reviews.text: The first pair I purchased we're perfect so I figured I'd order another pair to alternate the first pair with. The second pair are a lot smaller (both pair we're size medium) but they seemed to provide more compression that way too. The downside is that pair tore as soon as I put them on the first time! And the pinky finger was a lot longer than the first pair, so much so that I had to fold it down because it went passed the end of my finger.
customer_reviews.author: cashley84

customer_reviews.title: Good for Those Painful Days
customer_reviews.text: I like these gloves when my hands are especially sore, my fingers are a little swollen or my thumb joints ache. The stretch is tight and the fabric rebounds when the gloves are removed. I've worn these about a dozen times so far, and they have not stretched out - the fabric has good memory. I bought a second pair. My physical therapist suggested a pair of compression gloves - these are much more effective than Isotoner's beige compression gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Aptos Girl

customer_reviews.title: Really helps aching finger joints and nice looking too
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that I found these gloves. They are well made and really help with my R.A. I had tried a pair of cheap compression gloves from the drugstore once and they tore the first time that I put them on. These are much better made, they really help with my aching finger joints, and they don't look particularly "medical", they just look like funky gloves. I do wish they came in black but, hey, you can't have everything! Great purchase, I plan on getting another pair to keep handy in my briefcase.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Guy

customer_reviews.title: very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis that has been progressing since moving back to the East Coast. I did a bunch of research and settled on these fingerless gloves so I could continue to work without having my hands on a heater all day. I'm glad I bought them. My only complaint would be the top binding is tight and restricts circulation to my finger tips but may stretch out over time - I just take them off when my fingertips feel cold. The other complaint is my skin itches for a bit after I put them on but I either get used to it or the reaction stops over time. - Rick's wife Ann
customer_reviews.author: RICK’s wife Ann

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves but...
customer_reviews.text: Update: after only having these gloves for a short time one of the seams already opened. I hand washed them and didn’t put in dryer. They still feel great but a bit disappointed. Seller is a pleasure to deal with. Just got these gloves today and they are great so far especially since they cover the knuckles on my fingers closest to my finger nails which is what i need. Added bonus they keep my hands warm too even with the open fingertips. Much better than another brand i bought which was more $$ and much looser and shorter.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a medium and I think its been working for me. The compression is light but does the job. In a past couple weeks I've been wearing this I have noticed some pain relief. I'm constantly typing all day so it gets very uncomfortable. Make sure you get the right size because my wife (the left one on the picture) used this and it didn't work for her. The only disappointment I have is that its already wearing out. It tore from the seam as shown in picture. Probably not the best quality.
customer_reviews.author: Darkmane

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful!!!! Compression is just right not too tight.They are warm and comfortable,they breath,help with Arthritis pain and helps with Raynauds!!!! And circulation!!! I am so very happy and pleased with the product!!! I also purchased a pair for my Mother.She loves hers as well!!!!! I would recommend this product highly and for purchase!!!! Thank you so very much!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: My pain is at the base of each thumb. I have a wrist support that keeps the thumb immobilized, which takes the pain away, but makes it very hard to do any work. Thought I'd give them a try. My observations: VERY well made. Not some thin and flimsy gloves I've tried. Does offer compression and you can feel the warmth in your hand, so should be good for arthritis in your hands. Didn't completely take way the thumb pain, but it was reduced.
customer_reviews.author: BrianA

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I have RA and OA and I'm wondering if I don't have carpel tunnel as well, and after decades of typing, I started a new career ... handling packages. These gloves have been an absolute lifesaver! Although I still experience some pain while wearing them, it's minimal compared to not wearing them. I can definitely feel an improvement and without them, I don't know that I could continue with my new job. I will probably order another pair so I will have a pair for work and for home. If you have any type of arthritis, these are definitely worth trying!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Patti

customer_reviews.title: The tag inside the glove irritated my wrist
customer_reviews.text: Within less than a minute the tag inside the glove irritated my wrist to the point I knew I would not be able to use them. I couldn't even keep it on long enough to try crocheting with it. I couldn't see ANY way to cut it off without either having the problem be worse with a shortened tag or ending up with a hole in the glove. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wich

customer_reviews.title: They are worth their weight in gold
customer_reviews.text: I can't begin to tell you how much I like these gloves! I bought another brand before and they helped, but not that much. My sons said they had seen some other globes with coper and that people seem to like them. I decided to try. I'm so, so glad I did! My level of pain has gone down significantly!!! I stopped taking pain meds several times a day. My students asked me why I'm wearing gloves and I told them that I went punk. :)
customer_reviews.author: Miriam B.

customer_reviews.title: A new life for my aching hands.
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat skeptical but I ordered a pair. They are fantastic. I no longer wake up in the night because of the pain in my hands. Now I sleep without pain, wake up in the morning. After my shower, I leave them off for several hours and continue to have no pain. As soon as I get home, I put them on and keep them on until the next morning. My hands feel like I'm in my 60's again. I bought 2 more pairs because I don't want to be without them for any length of time.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Johns Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I just received these today and immediately put them on and I LOVE them! The fingers are longer than on my other arthritis gloves because I have arthritis in my whole hand and other gloves simply don't cover my knuckles. I ordered a small as I have small hands (ring finger size 5 when not swollen) and they are snug, but that is how i like them. I will immediately order a second pair because in the fall and winter I tend to wear them all the time. Great Product
customer_reviews.author: crazy cat lady

customer_reviews.title: Work well in limiting joint motion.
customer_reviews.text: Works for me. I have ulnar nerve compression the elbow (from leaning on my elbows too much at the office), which results in a bit of pinky finger catch, especially at night. I put some Icy Hot on first, then the glove. These compression gloves help to limit movement of the hand joints, resulting in less pain in the morning. For me, these gloves do not look professional enough for mew to wear at the office. Would buy another pair if they came out with a jet black version.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I wear them 24/7 except for cleaning and such. After trying some of the other compression gloves this latest two pairs were to replace those others that started falling apart almost as soon as I got them. My oldest compression gloves are Dr. Fredrick's and I've given up looking at other brands. These gloves wear well, offer the most compression of any of the others I've tried. This is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: ehhh kind of uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: It maybe that im not used to these or something. I'm not sure but i have very short chubby fingers and I have to really shove the gloves down to get even my finger tips to go thru. The fabric is not comfortable to me. I'm gonna try wearing them more often see if maybe I just need to get used to wearing them but right now they feel very tight around my wrists and overall to long on the fingers. I will update after I have tried them a little longer but right now I can only say Ehhh. Not the worst but certainly not love at first use.
customer_reviews.author: Gina CentralTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my hands warm all day
customer_reviews.text: These gloves help my arthritis somewhat, in part because they hold in heat. The pain is in my thumbs, so I cut the other fingers shorter. I also carefully removed the labels and wear them inside out, so the seams don't irritate my skin. I sometimes wear a BraceAbility thumb splint over them, which is better than the ones that are made for the splint. I ordered several extra with the discount, so I can wash and swap them out frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S.

customer_reviews.title: No consistency
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these gloves a few months ago and loved them. I have significant arthritis issues in my fingers and these gloves really helped a lot. But I ordered a second pair (this order I'm reporting on) and they were nothing like the first pair. This second pair was WAY too tight and had fingers that were so short they didn't reach the top finger joints (the middle joints are my biggest issue). I don't know why the same brand and the same size would be so different. But the second pair were horrible. I threw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Somers

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money !
customer_reviews.text: Well,........second time wearing these and the side rips out. They are too tight at the finger tips, but they don't seem to crimp my palm inwards like the Copper Fit gloves do. I would think for the money these should last longer than twice !
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Martin

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality and difficult to understand the sizing
customer_reviews.text: The picture on the sizing chart is very misleading and inaccurate, and as a result the size I ordered was too small. Beyond that, I could see right off that bat that the quality was not very good, with some stitching that was already starting to unravel at the fingertips. I sent them back for a refund, and would suggest to others that you look for a higher quality product with a more understandable sizing chart.
customer_reviews.author: bendwriter

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, Great Compression and Warm
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a Med, wear Lg. women's. I measured between a Med and a Large. I type all day, have some OA in hands and my hands get cold at times. These are warm, fit snug, are comfortable. I'm ordering a 2nd pair in Large for days I need less compression, to compare the size, and I want the warmth. Quality is excellent, I will wash in cold water let air dry, 2nd pair needed for this as well. These do not look like Medical gloves! They have stretch, have almost a velour feel with good compression, and I would wear them out anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these only two weeks ago and they are already falling apart! I walk my dogs every morning and I needed the gloves to help me with the pain and help me with the grip. I have 2 large dogs and I have rheumatoid arthritis that are very painful, so it is hard to hold the leashes. But now I have to buy a different pair of gloves! This is ridiculous that I only wear them in the morning to walk my dogs and they are coming apart at the seams! I even bought them bigger so they wouldn't be too tight! Totally a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Stljodi

customer_reviews.title: FINGER COVERAGE!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pair of gloves that left only the finger tips exposed for data entry in a cold office. These are as close as it gets from what I've found. My hands are 3 and half inches across (exclude thumb) and a little over 8 inches long from the tip of my middle finger to end of my hand. These go down my wrist 2 and a half inches. I bought the Large and although they look super small when you take them out of the package, they fit great. Added bonus is they are compression gloves so they are a "hug" for your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Injury Protection
customer_reviews.text: Although I don't have arthritis my old hands bleed at with a mere bump. Putting my hand in my pocket then tears off scabs. It's a mess. I use sunscreens, moisturizers and wear long sleeves outside. I researched light gloves that I can wear casually, are light and provide some protection against bumps. Thus far these Dr. F gloves have saved me several wounds and thy are not that intrusive.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! As a physician and as a daughter
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my dad’s progressing osteoarthritis and recent tendonitis in the thumbs. He is a woodworker and constantly uses his hands for fine (and repetitive) movements. He loves them and has worn them almost every night after coming in from his wood shop to rest. He sleeps well with them. He tells me they have given him an amazing relief of his pain after overuse of his hands and he has started wearing them more throughout he day as he is working, too. They fit as expected- based on glove size, he says they are comfortable, and they have held up for over a year with daily use!
customer_reviews.author: Aerodoc

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP CHINESE RIP OFF! STITCHING RIPPING ON DAY ONE! DO NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.text: I DO NOT RECOMMEND! Only got these yesterday (12-05-2019) and have only worn them once for an hour or so and there is already a hole opening up at the outer stitching! I was almost expecting this, but it is still TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE. Guess I'm goung to have to go through the hassle of returning them. Even the time that I wore them, I saw no real improvement or relief of my normal arthritic discomfort!
customer_reviews.author: Scrappycat001

customer_reviews.title: Good compression for hands & fingers.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to alleviate pain & tingling for carpal tunnel. Works well. I frequently also need compression for wrist while awaiting surgery for wrist fracture malunion and the carpal tunnel. So, I purchased the Pressure Perfect Wrist Brace, as well. They work great together. Only issue is the left compression glove has a tag inside the wrist. (The right glove has NO tag.) If I combine the brace & left glove, it irritates the wrist. Since I have no problems with my right hand, I tried turning the right glove inside-out to wear it on my left hand. Problem solved! I highly recommend both products
customer_reviews.author: Pat H

customer_reviews.title: Horribly sharp tag/ was sold used pair
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these gloves, but the tag on the inside was like a blade cutting into my wrist. Apparently someone else thought the same thing and cut one of the tags out. I received a pair that had obviously been used. A tag cut off(poorly) on the inside was to annoying to keep. With the pressure, that last thing one would want is a sharp edge pressing into you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many gloves over the years for my arm and hand pain. These Dr. Frederick's Original Arthritis Gloves are the best of all. The fit is perfect and they provide the pressure and firmness needed. I put them on while at work and take them off when go home. I put them on again at night and apply warm pad. No sore fingers in the morning. I mostly use the right hand one as that's the hand I mostly have pain. I would recommend these to any one looking for gloves to help ease pain in their hands and wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: my hands hurt so bad that I can't even move them
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands, sometimes at night, after crocheting or gardening, my hands hurt so bad that I can't even move them. I decided to try these gloves when using my hands for repetitive use - they are WONDERFUL! I put the gloves on under my gardening gloves, pruned everything in the garden and my hands did not hurt at night. I highly recommend if you have problems with your hands hurting after a day of work!
customer_reviews.author: jkblues

product_meta.title: Dr. Frederick's Original Arthritis Gloves for Women & Men - Compression for Arthritis Pain Relief - Rheumatoid & Osteoarthritis - Medium
feature_bullets: INCLUDES 2 GLOVES: You'll receive one pair of Dr. Frederick's Original Arthritis Gloves. Available in 3 Sizes: Small, Medium and Large. See our chart for sizing recommendations.

RELIEVE ACHES AND STIFFNESS: When your hands hurt, it can distract from your whole life. By providing mild compression, these give extra support to thumbs, fingers, wrists and knuckles by focusing on pressure points and providing extra warmth. This allows you to focus on what's really important in your life!

EFFECTIVE, NON-INVASIVE RELIEF: Continue living your life as you always have. Open fingertip design lets you use your phone, type, tie your shoes and pick up glass jars without fear of fumbling or slipping. Feel, touch and grip without any extra bulk.
EASY TO CLEAN: Simply place these gloves in with your normal laundry. Wash and dry with your clothes every few days to keep them fresh and long-lasting.
COMFORTABLE AND BREATHABLE DESIGN: With a cotton-spandex blend, you'll find a snug fit that won't make you sweat all day long.
